US Politics – twitchy.com http://twitchy.com Who Said What Fri, 13 May 2016 04:51:04 +0000 en-US hourly 1 https://wordpress.org/?v=4.4.2 twitchy.com http://twitchy.com/wp-content/resources/logo.jpg http://twitchy.com 116 130 twitchy.com Administration issues decree on transgender access in public schools; Texas Gov. defies His Majesty http://twitchy.com/brettt-3136/2016/05/13/administration-issues-decree-on-transgender-access-in-public-schools-texas-gov-defies-his-majesty/ http://twitchy.com/brettt-3136/2016/05/13/administration-issues-decree-on-transgender-access-in-public-schools-texas-gov-defies-his-majesty/#respond Fri, 13 May 2016 04:51:04 +0000 http://twitchy.com/?p=505746 That's a nice school you've got there … shame if anything happened to your funding over transgender access to locker rooms and restrooms.

The post Administration issues decree on transgender access in public schools; Texas Gov. defies His Majesty appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]> We know that President Obama isn’t royalty because he said so himself in 2013, when pressed on the question of why he wasn’t issuing executive actions to speed immigration reform along. “I’m not a king,” he confessed to viewers of Univision and Telemundo, obviously frustrated by the fact.

That was years ago; is he a king now? The Obama administration has issued a directive which is being sent to school districts Friday requiring them to allow students to use whichever restroom and locker room matches their gender identity.

#BREAKING US gives directive to schools on transgender bathroom accesshttps://t.co/MxkXo9wUlS pic.twitter.com/fU0ac6NJ5h

— Houston News (@abc13houston) May 13, 2016

“There is no room in our schools for discrimination of any kind, including discrimination against transgender students on the basis of their sex,” Attorney General Loretta Lynch said in a statement.

DOJ and DOEduc serve notice that to enforce non-discrimination they regard a student’s gender identity the same as the student’s sex.

— Mark Knoller (@markknoller) May 13, 2016

School officials are reminded that abiding by non-discrimination provisions of the law are a condition of receiving federal funds.

— Mark Knoller (@markknoller) May 13, 2016

Gov. Greg Abbott didn’t hesitate to remind the president that he’s still not royalty.

I announced today that Texas is fighting this. Obama can't rewrite the Civil Rights Act. He's not a King. #tcot https://t.co/vDgfQPZXjR

— Greg Abbott (@GregAbbott_TX) May 13, 2016

@GregAbbott_TX @seanmdav Obama's not a king? Oh crap, then what explains the past 7 years? Certainly not adherence to the Constitution …

— Joe Public (@lostnatn) May 13, 2016

The post Administration issues decree on transgender access in public schools; Texas Gov. defies His Majesty appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]> http://twitchy.com/brettt-3136/2016/05/13/administration-issues-decree-on-transgender-access-in-public-schools-texas-gov-defies-his-majesty/feed/ 0 President Reality Show teams up with MTV, Macklemore to tackle opioid epidemic http://twitchy.com/brettt-3136/2016/05/13/president-reality-show-teams-up-with-mtv-macklemore-to-tackle-opioid-epidemic/ http://twitchy.com/brettt-3136/2016/05/13/president-reality-show-teams-up-with-mtv-macklemore-to-tackle-opioid-epidemic/#respond Fri, 13 May 2016 04:16:37 +0000 http://twitchy.com/?p=505733 With a dozen rappers and musicians deployed to push criminal justice reform, President Obama seems to have run out of options for his opioid project.

The post President Reality Show teams up with MTV, Macklemore to tackle opioid epidemic appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]> On Thursday, while Office of National Drug Control Policy director Michael Botticelli was making an appeal on behalf of President Obama for $1.1 billion in funding to fight the country’s opioid and heroin epidemic, the president himself continued to blur the line between elected office and reality TV by teaming up with rapper Macklemore and MTV, the reality show network once known for playing music videos.

Honored to be at @WhiteHouse with @MTV to talk to @POTUS about opioid addiction. Really excited for this project. pic.twitter.com/feb7AfoHqn

— Macklemore (@macklemore) May 12, 2016

It was just short of a month ago that President Obama met with a host of rappers and musicians at the White House, including Busta Rhymes, Common, J. Cole, Ludacris, Nicki Minaj, Alicia Keys, Janelle Monae, Chance the Rapper, DJ Khaled, Wale, Pusha T, and Rick Ross, to enlist their help in furthering one of his many No. 1 priorities, criminal justice reform. It looks like Macklemore will have to do the heavy lifting on this one himself.

 

In addition to whatever the president is doing with Macklemore, his administration will be holding Twitter chat Friday afternoon to discuss the opioid epidemic.

Join us tomorrow at 3pm ET for a Twitter chat on the need for additional funding to address the #OpioidEpidemic pic.twitter.com/K3wyW1Bc1H

— U.S. Drug Policy (@ONDCP) May 13, 2016

On closer inspection, it looks as though the White House might be stinging from a judge’s ruling that the president’s funding of “cost sharing reduction payments” through Obamacare is unconstitutional, as Congress holds the power of the purse. The original Tweet announcing the online chat, which has since been deleted, called for congressional action on funding, not additional funding:

It looks like someone’s leaving the door open …

The post President Reality Show teams up with MTV, Macklemore to tackle opioid epidemic appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]> http://twitchy.com/brettt-3136/2016/05/13/president-reality-show-teams-up-with-mtv-macklemore-to-tackle-opioid-epidemic/feed/ 0 Defense Sec. Ash Carter ‘confident we’re going to get to the right place’ on transgender troops http://twitchy.com/brettt-3136/2016/05/12/defense-sec-ash-carter-confident-were-going-to-get-to-the-right-place-on-transgender-troops/ http://twitchy.com/brettt-3136/2016/05/12/defense-sec-ash-carter-confident-were-going-to-get-to-the-right-place-on-transgender-troops/#respond Fri, 13 May 2016 02:31:17 +0000 http://twitchy.com/?p=505729 Defense Sec. Ash Carter said Thursday that the issue is settled in principle, and only practical concerns are keeping transgender people from serving.

The post Defense Sec. Ash Carter ‘confident we’re going to get to the right place’ on transgender troops appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]> Speaking at a question-and-answer session Thursday with cadets at the Air Force Academy, Defense Secretary Ash Carter maintained that when it comes to transgender people serving in the military, “the question of principle” has been resolved, leaving only practical issues to be worked out.

Carter: Military can work out 'practical issues' to lift transgender ban https://t.co/bkfHfgWplM pic.twitter.com/Rd0P5F8yGB

— Military Times (@MilitaryTimes) May 12, 2016

Writing for the Air Force Times, Stephen Losey reports that Carter told the cadets that the Defense Department will approach implementation in a “careful, thoughtful manner,” and added that he’s “confident we’re going to get to the right place.”

@MilitaryTimes Yep, more social engineering!

— Luana H. (@LuanaMacLac) May 12, 2016

Last July, Carter announced that the military’s prohibition on transgender troops was outdated and was “causing uncertainty that distracts commanders from our core missions,” which he says will continue to revolve around Russia, the Asia-Pacific region, North Korea, Iran, and ISIS.

Though Carter didn’t go into detail about the practical issues that must be addressed to ease the transition, Losey writes that the Pentagon may have to “sort out other, military-specific questions, such as when transgender troops begin adhering to a new dress code and grooming standards, how their fitness standards would change, and whether the military health care system would provide them with hormone replacement therapy or gender reassignment surgery.”

In February 2015, an Army commandant at Ft. Leavenworth approved hormone therapy for Chelsea Manning to transition to a woman. Manning is serving a 35-year sentence for leaking classified information to WikiLeaks.

 

 

The post Defense Sec. Ash Carter ‘confident we’re going to get to the right place’ on transgender troops appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]> http://twitchy.com/brettt-3136/2016/05/12/defense-sec-ash-carter-confident-were-going-to-get-to-the-right-place-on-transgender-troops/feed/ 0 Caleb Howe reveals what REALLY went wrong with Chelsea Clinton’s husband’s hedge fund http://twitchy.com/sd-3133/2016/05/12/caleb-howe-reveals-what-really-went-wrong-with-chelsea-clintons-husbands-hedge-fund/ http://twitchy.com/sd-3133/2016/05/12/caleb-howe-reveals-what-really-went-wrong-with-chelsea-clintons-husbands-hedge-fund/#respond Fri, 13 May 2016 01:23:47 +0000 http://twitchy.com/?p=505711 Ha!

The post Caleb Howe reveals what REALLY went wrong with Chelsea Clinton’s husband’s hedge fund appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]>

@CalebHowe @DailyCaller wow, with a record like that, he should have a government job in no time!

— Rogelio (@Roger247) May 13, 2016

Have you heard? Chelsea Clinton’s husband Marc Mezvinsky is shutting down his hedge fund:

Chelsea Clinton’s Husband Closing Hedge Fund After Losing 90 Percent Of Its Money: https://t.co/fIVE4gOqXR pic.twitter.com/GO4wTCkGBd

— The Daily Caller (@DailyCaller) May 12, 2016

More from The Daily Caller:

Marc Mezvinsky promoted Eaglevale Hellenic Opportunity as a means to bet on, and profit from, a Greek economic recovery. The fund was a spinoff of Eaglevale Partners, a larger hedge fund founded by Mezvinsky and two colleagues from his days working at Goldman Sachs.

…

The effect on Mezvinsky’s hedge fund has been gruesome. It raised $25 million for its investments, but had already lost about 40 percent of its value by early 2015. Rather than shuttering the fund then, Mezvinsky pressed ahead.

Now, The New York Times’ DealBook reports, the end has finally come, but only after the fund lost 90 percent of investors’ money. The fund’s closure was reportedly announced to investors a month ago.

Now, you might think that all this happened because Mezvinsky was reckless and irresponsible. But you’d be wrong. RedState’s Caleb Howe knows what the real problem was:

He tried to care about money but couldn't. Like at all. Not even other people's. https://t.co/R8nHDRnTqC

— Caleb Howe (@CalebHowe) May 13, 2016

Ha! Chelsea feels his pain.

@CalebHowe Gosh, I hope they don't live in poverty after this!

— Robin Little (@RobL777) May 13, 2016

No kidding. It’s rough being dead broke!

***

Related:

She’s just like us! Chelsea Clinton reveals her struggle to care about money [Photoshop]

The post Caleb Howe reveals what REALLY went wrong with Chelsea Clinton’s husband’s hedge fund appeared first on twitchy.com.

Darrell Issa: Obamacare ruling proof of administration’s ‘blatant disregard for the Constitution’ http://twitchy.com/brettt-3136/2016/05/12/rep-darrell-issa-obamacare-ruling-proof-of-administrations-blatant-disregard-for-the-constitution/ http://twitchy.com/brettt-3136/2016/05/12/rep-darrell-issa-obamacare-ruling-proof-of-administrations-blatant-disregard-for-the-constitution/#respond Fri, 13 May 2016 00:17:40 +0000 http://twitchy.com/?p=505705 "Professor POTUS" seems to have missed the part of the Constitution that gives Congress the power of the purse, with no exception for Obamacare.

The post Rep. Darrell Issa: Obamacare ruling proof of administration’s ‘blatant disregard for the Constitution’ appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]> The president is cranky that the Senate still hasn’t called a vote to confirm his Supreme Court nominee, so much so that the White House recently put together a cutesy video in which “Professor POTUS” walks them through “Supreme Court 101.”

Rep. Darrell Issa certainly doesn’t need the president to teach him constitutional law, and we might have found the reason he jumped a fence at RNC headquarters Thursday: he was excited to spread the news that the courts had dealt Obamacare another blow.

BREAKING: Federal Judge rules Obamacare cost-sharing unconstitutional. My statement: https://t.co/wiwNP4PIru pic.twitter.com/FZ950QNOdD

— Darrell Issa (@DarrellIssa) May 12, 2016

House Speaker Paul Ryan, though, had already heard the news that a judge had ruled for the House GOP, finding that the Obama administration requires Congress to appropriate any money it spends to pay insurers “cost sharing reduction payments.” Ryan called the ruling “an historic win for the Constitution and the American people.”

Huge victory in another challenge against Obamacare. #txlege #tcot https://t.co/MoonqwpXaE

— Greg Abbott (@GregAbbott_TX) May 12, 2016

Judge rules in favor of Congressional GOPers on Obamacare lawsuit. Judge says Admin can't spend Obamacare $ not appropriated by Congress

— Chad Pergram (@ChadPergram) May 12, 2016

The TL;DR version of today's Obamacare decision: the Obama administration cannot spend money that Congress didn't appropriate.

— Gabriel Malor (@gabrielmalor) May 12, 2016

Sounds like Constitution 101 to us. Issa didn’t mince words in his statement, calling the ruling “proof positive that the Obama Administration is continuing in its blatant and willful disregard for the Constitution,” following seven-and-a-half years of continued overreach.

Is the House GOP’s victory America’s loss? Issa’s critics seem to think so.

@DarrellIssa @GroverNorquist You forgot to say Bush appointee who immediately suspended her verdict because she knows it will be overturned.

— Clayton Strickland (@MottdeWitt) May 12, 2016

@DarrellIssa the Activist GOP judge will be overruled on appeal. House GOP has no standing to bring suit. You lose again

— Sam_Handwich (@Holdthebaloney) May 12, 2016

So now activist judges are a bad thing?

@DarrellIssa How much did it cost to buy this one bad jurist that will have her feckless decision reversed? Nice try though!

— Daniel Davis (@cycleoptions) May 12, 2016

@DarrellIssa Give it a rest, and actually do something that helps the average joe. You keep wasting our $$ on witch hunts.

— Henny Penny (@hennypennyoh) May 12, 2016

@DarrellIssa Always great when more poor Americans suffer and die, right Darrell? Separates the winners from the losers.

— Max (@fatalmocking) May 12, 2016

Speaking of losers:

So the two big Obama accomplishments, Obamacare and the Iran Nuclear Deal, turn out to be Big Lies: https://t.co/wV6F105Gw0@Instapundit

— Straight Outta Pali (@jslemaker) May 12, 2016

Never was #ObamaCare about healthcare. All evidence indicates voter fraud scheme to register 68 million new voters. https://t.co/WSqPSVWb1u

— Rob Cunningham (@Rob_Cunningham) May 12, 2016

 

 

The post Rep. Darrell Issa: Obamacare ruling proof of administration’s ‘blatant disregard for the Constitution’ appeared first on twitchy.com.

Hillary email suggests she had problems with unsecure phone lines, too [pic] http://twitchy.com/sd-3133/2016/05/12/why-stop-at-unsecure-servers-hillary-email-suggests-she-had-problems-with-unsecure-phone-lines-too-pic/ http://twitchy.com/sd-3133/2016/05/12/why-stop-at-unsecure-servers-hillary-email-suggests-she-had-problems-with-unsecure-phone-lines-too-pic/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 23:05:00 +0000 http://twitchy.com/?p=505690 "The call is coming from inside the house."

The post Why stop at unsecure servers? Hillary email suggests she had problems with unsecure phone lines, too [pic] appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]>

"The call is coming from inside the house." https://t.co/PIkQv9RnFr

— Kris Kinder (@kris_kinder) May 12, 2016

Well, this is reassuring:

“I give up. Call me on my home #": Clinton abandoned secure line to use home phone https://t.co/7UPq4j6rTs pic.twitter.com/cg5A3J81h6

— Oliver Darcy (@oliverdarcy) May 12, 2016

More from The Hill:

It’s unclear whether the two did connect, or if they moderated any discussion they may have had to avoid sensitive topics while on an unsecure landline.

But the episode is likely to cause concern among critics of Clinton, who have previously accused her of resorting to unsecure forms of communication out of convenience, potentially jeopardizing sensitive information. Another email of Clinton’s, released in January, appeared to show her telling a top aide to remove identifying details and send a sensitive document through a “nonsecure” channel instead of via “secure fax.”

“This drip, drip of new Clinton emails show Hillary Clinton could not care less about the security of her communications,” said Tom Fitton, the president of the watchdog group, Judicial Watch, in a statement releasing Thursday’s email. “How many other smoking gun emails are Hillary Clinton and her co-conspirators in the Obama administration hiding from the American people?”

Ugh.

Geez. https://t.co/Ie9wUUYThO

— Brittany (@bccover) May 12, 2016

Similar Hillary-Mills conversation in 2009: I give up with this State Dept. email. Let's go with my home server. https://t.co/Gs3VVeqZBw

— The Right Wing M (@TheRightWingM) May 12, 2016

Conversation about an unsecured phone call on an unsecured email sent on an unsecured server. https://t.co/PIkQv9RnFr

— Kris Kinder (@kris_kinder) May 12, 2016

@thehill If it were anyone else, theyd be indicted for sure. This woman is powerful and not in a good way.

— Myra Henry (@myrahenry24) May 12, 2016

True story.

S̶e̶c̶u̶r̶e̶ ̶p̶h̶o̶n̶e̶ ̶l̶i̶n̶e̶s̶.̶
S̶e̶c̶u̶r̶e̶ ̶f̶a̶x̶e̶s̶.̶
S̶e̶c̶u̶r̶e̶ ̶e̶m̶a̶i̶l̶s̶.̶
Wants to be President https://t.co/09B8CAthWO

— Razor (@hale_razor) May 12, 2016

.@thehill "It’s 3 a.m and your children are safe and asleep. Who do you want answering the [unsecured] phone?"

— Olympia Watch (@OlympiaWatch) May 12, 2016

The post Why stop at unsecure servers? Hillary email suggests she had problems with unsecure phone lines, too [pic] appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]> http://twitchy.com/sd-3133/2016/05/12/why-stop-at-unsecure-servers-hillary-email-suggests-she-had-problems-with-unsecure-phone-lines-too-pic/feed/ 0 Something fishy: Trump camp tries to distance Donald from (former?) butler, but what about this? [pics] http://twitchy.com/sd-3133/2016/05/12/something-fishy-trump-camp-tries-to-distance-donald-from-former-butler-but-what-about-this-pics/ http://twitchy.com/sd-3133/2016/05/12/something-fishy-trump-camp-tries-to-distance-donald-from-former-butler-but-what-about-this-pics/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 22:26:50 +0000 http://twitchy.com/?p=505659 Hmmm.

The post Something fishy: Trump camp tries to distance Donald from (former?) butler, but what about this? [pics] appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]>

So Trump campaign lied about the butler no longer working there? https://t.co/emEzqFseoC

— Greg Pollowitz (@GPollowitz) May 12, 2016

@GPollowitz Did they just, I don't know, forget all the fawning coverage from earlier this year that included the butler?

— Brian Cates (@drawandstrike) May 12, 2016

So, you know that story about Donald Trump’s super-racist Mar-a-Lago butler? Well, Team Trump is now feverishly trying to do damage control:

A spokeswoman for the Trump campaign says, "This individual has not worked at Mar-a-Lago for many years." https://t.co/75yR781jUQ

— Margot Sanger-Katz (@sangerkatz) May 12, 2016

Trump spox re: butler: "He does not work at mar-a-Lago and hasn't in many years. We totally disavow and condemn these horrible statements."

— Alexandra Jaffe (@ajjaffe) May 12, 2016

No doubt Anthony Senecal didn’t become a crazy racist until after he left Mar-a-Lago. Because let’s face it: Trump would never associate with someone like that. No sirree.

Here’s the thing, though. Just less than two months ago, The New York Times ran a profile on Senecal, who was then described as “Mr. Trump’s longtime butler.” Does anyone remember Trump’s people trying to distance him from Senecal back then?

I mean this–from March 15–is pretty unequivocal. https://t.co/DeSsmZiuG4 pic.twitter.com/yuXztDezzh

— southpaw (@nycsouthpaw) May 12, 2016

he tried to retire in 2009, Trump persuaded him to stay on in another capacity… he works there. pic.twitter.com/Qahxi5mghj

— southpaw (@nycsouthpaw) May 12, 2016

Wait, so Senecal was introducing Trump at Mar-a-Lago on March 6? Even though he hadn’t worked there for “many years”? And even though he’d made many of his “horrible statements” in 2015?

Somebody’s got some ‘splaining to do …

Either Trump’s spox is lying, or NYT lied about butler on March 16, 2016: https://t.co/AdBYO2xdko
(h/t @nycsouthpaw) pic.twitter.com/dUSLFd0yas

— T. Becket Adams (@BecketAdams) May 12, 2016

What reason would the NYT have to lie about the butler’s employment on March 16, 2016? He’s an unknown entity and unremarkable. So…

— T. Becket Adams (@BecketAdams) May 12, 2016

Senecal also appeared on CNN back in March — before the Times’ profile was published — singing Trump’s praises.

The Trump campaign didn’t run from him then, either.

***

Related:

Donald Trump’s butler explains why Mar-a-Lago doesn’t hire Americans

Yes, Trump’s butler sounds like a flaming racist nutjob, but why no MSM freakout over THESE guys?

The post Something fishy: Trump camp tries to distance Donald from (former?) butler, but what about this? [pics] appeared first on twitchy.com.

Sitting member of Congress climbing over a fence to gain access. There's an image for a day Donald Trump visits DC. https://t.co/tCHDimOiID

— Pete Schroeder (@peteschroeder) May 12, 2016

Donald Trump met with Speaker Paul Ryan and other Republicans at RNC headquarters today, and a fence around the building did not deter Rep. Darrell Issa:

.@DarrellIssa jumping fence at the end of this to get into RNC pic.twitter.com/m8Fpf7dfgR

And that’s how it’s done!

@vgmac I hope he's not asking Trump to head up border security.

]]> http://twitchy.com/dougp-3137/2016/05/12/rep-darrell-issa-undeterred-by-rnc-hq-fence-during-trumpryan-meeting-video/feed/ 0 Yes, Trump’s butler sounds like a flaming racist nutjob, but why no MSM freakout over THESE guys? http://twitchy.com/sd-3133/2016/05/12/yes-trumps-butler-sounds-like-a-flaming-racist-nutjob-but-why-no-msm-freakout-over-these-guys/ http://twitchy.com/sd-3133/2016/05/12/yes-trumps-butler-sounds-like-a-flaming-racist-nutjob-but-why-no-msm-freakout-over-these-guys/#respond Thu, 12 May 2016 20:52:26 +0000 http://twitchy.com/?p=505629 "It's really awkward when past associates of Presidential candidates use crazy, violent rhetoric."

The post Yes, Trump’s butler sounds like a flaming racist nutjob, but why no MSM freakout over THESE guys? appeared first on twitchy.com.

]]>

Both bad. https://t.co/it8hpZwTP4

— pgepps (@pgepps) May 12, 2016

Well, now that Donald Trump has pretty much secured the GOP nomination, the MSM can finally get around to vetting him and digging up every last nugget of dirt they can find. Today’s big story is Anthony Senecal, Trump’s racist, sexist, and all-around-awful Mar-a-Lago butler:

NEW: Trump’s butler hates ‘negroes,’ wanted to ‘carpet bomb’ Ferguson, called ‘Killery’ Clinton a ‘c**t’ https://t.co/m0nVmVc1UW

— The Daily Beast (@thedailybeast) May 12, 2016

Here’s a taste:

“Looks like that sleezey bastard zero (O) is trying to out maneuver Congress again, if the truth be known this prick needs to be hung for treason!!!” Senecal declared on his Facebook page on April 21, 2015.

Senecal confirmed to Mother Jones that he wrote that post: “I wrote that. I believe that.”

…

When he read news that a Belgian newspaper was in hot water for portraying Barack and Michelle Obama as apes, he asked “with who are they in trouble with,” and said “I think the newspaper deserves a Pulitzer Prize !!!!!!” for the racist imagery.

There’s plenty more, of course.

Trump's butler called on Trump to “arrest & charge Beyonce & Jay-Z for ‘Providing Material Support for Terrorism'” https://t.co/MSIiaDlegU

— Asawin Suebsaeng (@swin24) May 12, 2016

Trump's butler / in-house "historian" sure loves using the word "negroes" a lot. Also, Confederate imagery: https://t.co/MSIiaDlegU

— Asawin Suebsaeng (@swin24) May 12, 2016

“time for our Military to drag that fraud out of the white mosque and hang his ass for treason…" https://t.co/MSIiaDlegU

— Asawin Suebsaeng (@swin24) May 12, 2016

A choice remark from Trump's butler about Hillary Clinton. https://t.co/HQe6zKBKzM pic.twitter.com/KTjlmIZ3p1

— Gideon Resnick (@GideonResnick) May 12, 2016

Charming.

at this point it would be weird if Trump *didn't* have a racist, Confederate-flag loving, & also bloodthirsty butler https://t.co/MSIiaDlegU

— Asawin Suebsaeng (@swin24) May 12, 2016

That’s a fair point, given some of the people Trump tends to attract and surround himself with. And Senecal indeed sounds like a walking, talking pile of steaming pig excrement.

But this latest exposé also raises an important question: Why are media only now so concerned about a presidential frontrunner’s past associates?

I guess Trump's butler is more important than Obama's pastor

— David Harsanyi (@davidharsanyi) May 12, 2016

Gee … funny how that works, isn’t it?

And Bill Clinton's political idol, and Hillary Clinton's paymasters. https://t.co/l9XGDVYNS6

— John Hayward (@Doc_0) May 12, 2016

It's really awkward when past associates of Presidential candidates use crazy, violent rhetoric. pic.twitter.com/RZAYteiHPw

— Countermoonbat (@CounterMoonbat) May 12, 2016

University of California system announces $8.4 million in support for undocumented students https://t.co/lo7geQSNQG pic.twitter.com/eyC8EgWIkJ

— NBC News (@NBCNews) May 12, 2016

From NBC News:

“Support for undocumented UC students has been a priority for Janet Napolitano since she became president of the University of California in the fall of 2013,” Steve Montiel, Napolitano’s press secretary told NBC News. “The $5 million she allocated for student services and financial support in 2013 was scheduled to end in June of this year, and now she’s providing another $7.5 million to UC campuses for the next three years. She’s also committing $5 million a year for at least three years to UC’s DREAM loan fund and $2.7 million over a three-year period to the Undocumented Legal Services Center at UC Davis, which will enable the center to expand the services it provides to students and then families.”
